channel.title: Custom interface buttons
channel.description:
If I made a custom interface through my client (pi) and I want to make a button on it lead to my forums page, would I have to code that client-side or would it be possible to add it server side?
I've added this:[code] case 17252: c.getPA().sendFrame126("www.mysite.com", 12000); break;[/code] to my clickingbuttons.java, but I don't know if server side will even recognize that case since I created it on the client-side.
Thanks for reading.

item.title: Custom interface buttons
item.dc:creator: @NieX NieX
item.description:
@NieX wrote:

ya, it’ll work. Just add the buttons sprites in the cache if it’s a gui you’re making… but if it’s a quest, then there’s no client sided needed as quests are already in the client… so just click somewhere in the quest tab, check your clients CMD for the ID of the place you want to link your forums and then use the clicking buttons code.

Good job

Read full topic

item.title: Custom interface buttons
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

I mean I added the sprites for the interface and the buttons in my Client files, not server side. I created the new interface ID (client side) out of a case that didn’t exist.

I know, that’s the case for the button, too. I just don’t understand why it’s not working D:

Read full topic

item.title: Custom interface buttons
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

What do you mean you created it client-side (clickingbuttons)? If you added the custom interface/button properly client-sided then all you’d need to do is find the button ID (which is seems you already have) and add the forums/site url…

So far, the clickingbuttons.java code looks correct…so what’s the issue.

Read full topic
